Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised
Reviews.Author: Maria Cocker
Reviews.Content: This is my review of the Samsung TL105.Let me start by saying that i was looking for a camera that would cost under $150. and be able to record HD video but it had to record in the new MP4 H.264 format because this is what is needed for uploading to YouTube.The TL105 is the only camera in this price range to have this format.My first impression of the camera was it is small but well built with it's stainless steel body.After using the camera for a week i am very impressed with the video quality and pictures from this diminutive camera.The HD videos download to the computer from the camera very quickly because of the H.264 format and look very good on YouTube.Just make sure you are using a class 6 SDHC card or better.A big plus is the software that comes with the camera (intelli-studio) it is very good.You can do all the editing you have to do like cut,trim,splice and transitions and even convert your video to a different format if you like,bravo samsung.Just made sure your computer has been built in the last five years to run the software.The only negative and it is not with the camera is that the USB cable that comes with it needs to be a little longer.Let me end by saying if you are looking for a compact camera under $150. that you would like to post HD videos to the internet i highly recommend the Samsung TL105.Videos taken with the TL105 can be seen at richpin06a on YouTube.P.S.The camera comes with the zoom set to mute so when you zoom it does not record sound when you get it.If you want it to record sound while zooming put the camera in video mode press the menu button.Then move down the right frame to voice there are three options the middle one will let you record sound while zooming.One last thing to use the digital image stabilization in video mode you have to turn off Smart Auto mode.

Reviews.Title: Full featured tiny camera
Reviews.Author: L. Rice "PWC"
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised by this little camera. I won it in an auction and didn't think much of it until I actually played with it.Cool features include*Iso adjustment up to 3200*Smile shutter*HD video*Custom color effect editor*Smart filter for special effects in picture AND video mode*Continuous shot*More effects that can be added in playback modeAnother cool thing if that you can register a face and it marks the face every time you take a picture of that person. That may link to the software but I run linux so I don't know.The zoom and focus is very loud, at first I thought it was defective because of all the ticking noises but that is normal. In video mode the default is no sound on zoom because it's a horrid noise but you can turn it on although you really don't want to, trust me it sounds awful.The picture quality is about normal. I'll rarely shoot 12mp, maybe 3 or 5mp max ever so it doesn't look the greatest there on the tiny sensor but for snapshots it's awesome.Overall this is a great little camera. All the little editing effects add a nice touch for teens and adults who don't know how to edit on a computer or don't want to spend the time doing it.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera for the Price and Size
Reviews.Author: Greg Shovlin
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests, this camera does very well for the price I paid for it and the size of it.It's very small but packs many features. It's slightly smaller than the size of a deck of cards.The pictures are really nice, crisp and vivid. The best photos are usually achieved with tampering with the manual settings to get the right photo. Like any good "photographer," you don't take just one picture of the same subject, but multiple to get that one great shot.The smart setting does an admirable job with calculating which setting is best for the current situation. This smart setting works best outside, and inside (if lighting is really good). Smart setting also works well for action shots once it recognizes your subject is moving around a lot. I found that my best shots were achieved with manual settings, but when I'm out and about outside, I stick to the auto-smart setting.The manual settings has many shooting options and they are as follows: Photo Size, Quality, EV, ISO, White Balance, Face Detection, Smart FR Edit, Focus Area, Metering, Photo Style Selector, Smart Filter, Image Adjust, ACB, Drive, DIS, and Voice.From this list, it becomes evident that a good amount of tinkering can find the best setting and that good photo.There is a button to the left of the power button that allows the user to switch between their personal manual settings and the automatic settings. Manual options also include whether to use normal AF, Macro, and Super Macro. The options to choose from multiple flash settings are in both the manual and automatic.My 1 gripe has a both a pro and a con. It is the charger that comes with the camera. It's really short. The con is obviously the length but the con that it's two parts and the one part that I like is the wall-plug itself. It has a USB port so I could probably use it to charge other USB based device via wall outlets (i.e., my iPod) the second part of the cable/charger is camera-to-PC connection (but I personally just use my SD drive in my laptop to transfer photos)Other reviews complained about the door for charger and the memory card but I have had no problems so far.This camera takes very good video as well. I don't use it too often but that's about it. Another small problem is when taking really close macro-shots, make sure you keep your hands as steady as possible or you'll get blurry photos, but do remember to take multiple photos of the same subject and delete the bad ones anyways.I got this camera along with a 4GB Transcend SDHC card for the same price of the camera itself compared at popular retail prices.The camera also arrived much sooner than expected (it actually arrived the same day my SDHC card did)tl;dr Good camera for the price, takes good photos and video, macro shots can be blurry if you're not steady and the charger is a little short.

Reviews.Title: The best camera under $150!
Reviews.Author: USF2012
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time researching different cameras before I decided to by this one and it's everything I hoped it would be. I decided on the Samsung over the Sony Cyber-shot W310 and the Kodak M575, which was a tough choice because my last two cameras have been Cyber-shots. The nod went to Samsung over the Kodak because of the ISO (up to 3200 on Samsung and only 1000 on Kodak as per the two respective brand websites) and the size (less than .7" vs .9" thin, and weighs slightly less). The Samsung and the Sony were very close, but it came down to price and universality (as in the Samsung's compliance with more types/brands of SD cards than the Sony, and the price of said cards). All three cameras were on sale and the Samsung was also the least expensive by $10 (not a significant dollar amount, but when the cameras were this close, it matters). The 4X optical zoom is perfect for what I need to shoot and the adjustable video quality is a nice feature. The "smart" mode gets the shot right 9 times out of ten and the interface is rather user friendly so adjusting settings isn't too difficult. I've heard complaints about the USB door not closing and mine works fine (I opened and closed it 20+ times in the parking lot to make sure that it worked fine) and that there's no volume on video when it's zoomed in, which is a simple fix under the video and then audio menu, turn it to the middle selection which is just a microphone and it will record sound at all points. This is the best point and shoot camera I've owned and I would definitely recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Incredible little camera
Reviews.Author: Edgardo Pichardo "Boomz"
Reviews.Content: This is the best compact camera close to the $100 price tag. Includes tons of features that actually are useful and work! Camera has a very short ready time after each shot, even with flash. Great for consecutive quick shooting. Smart mode is finally really smart. Camera would automatically select the best configuration according to light and distance conditions, almost always. Face detection a lot better than Samsung SD420 (which I own too). Very light and good quality build. Metal frame feels great. Big and clear screen. 720p is good. Low light/low artificial lightning photos and videos turn out very good (or acceptable at least). That's quite a feat. Remember this is a pocket sized camera (really small) with a wide angle lens, 720p video support and 12MP resolution pictures. Bundled with handy software for photo/video editing.This camera delivers unbeatable value on it's price and size category. Highly recommended.For best results, remember to use class 6 or higher SD memory card for fast picture and video saving, as another reviewer recommended.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Camera
Reviews.Author: SQL4Fun "sql4fun"
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for an inexpensive digital camera for my college-bound son.  The most important attribute was the ability to recharge the battery will it is still in the camera.  When inquiring at Best Buy last June, I was told that there are no cameras sold with that ability.  Imagine my surprise when I found this camera only one month later online.  Prior to this camera, he had a digital Cannon which required 2 AA batteries.  He told me that after about 50 pictures, it needed new batteries.  50 pictures to a college student is about 10 minutes of fun.  The picture quality is good and it is fairly easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Fuzzy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with this camera.  The size and features were great - exactly what I was looking for.  However, as I began taking pictures I could NOT get any picture to give me a crisp image like I was used to with my older Samsung camera (S860).  Even my very old 5 MP Kodak camera did a much better job at image quality.  Maybe a defective product?  I don't know.  The image looked great - nice and crisp/clear on the LCD screen until I pushed down the button to focus, then took the picture.  Every time the image would go fuzzy on the actual picture.  I messed with the settings for hours and still bad results.  I am sending back...

Reviews.Title: unacceptably grainy output
Reviews.Author: Anthony Wright
Reviews.Content: It was bought to replace a version of the same camera which was really good but which sadly was dropped and accidentally broken. Unfortunately this one is a dead loss with unacceptably grainy output. Unusable and very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: A great product
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera, feel bad cant buy any more of the 10hz10w. I would recommend this camera, the pictures are very clear, color is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: worked great until it broke :(
Reviews.Author: Margaret M. Fernandes
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for just under two years.  Was happy with it until one day it stopped working.  I turn it on and the lens comes out, it tried to focus, then beeps and shuts off.  Online Samsung support has been no help in diagnosing the problem.  Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: VERY FRAGILE
Reviews.Author: MARCIA
Reviews.Content: The first one I both, in the first day of use, felt down from less than 1 meter. It seemed to be ok but the shoot button locked. Things moved inside the camera. It was not possible to recover it. I bought the second one , same model, after one month of using, two black spots appeared in the LCD and, this time, without any fall or other thing that could cause any damage. This camera seemed to be very breakable. Unfortunately I gave up using sumsung.

Reviews.Title: Little Camera That Could
Reviews.Author: richpin
Reviews.Content: This 2010 model is better then the 2011 model that's the way it goes sometimes.They removed the mp4 H.264 video format which is much more advanced then the motion jpeg they replaced it with.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TL105 Camera - only 14 months use
Reviews.Author: Ernie Bryant
Reviews.Content: Was fairly happy with the camera until the display failed 2 months out of warranty.  Owned the camera for 14 months and it was not damaged or abused in any way.  Samsung wants $50 to repair and I pay the shipping to them too (about $10).  That is $60 for a $99 camera so repair is not an option.  Never had a digital camera go bad so soon.  Bad luck?  Can't say but won't buy another one of these for sure.

Reviews.Title: Good for the Low Price
Reviews.Author: R. Fought "supertallrich"
Reviews.Content: This is a decent little camera for the money.  It is very compact and travels well; for me this also means camera shake is an issue since it is so lightweight.  The Digital Image Stabilization function can help mitigate this, but you have to enable it every time you turn the camera on.  Which is odd as the movie stabilization function stays on between power cycles.  A firmware update would be nice to fix this issue.  The USB port cover is flimsy and gets in the way when connecting the cable, which itself is too short.  White balance can be hit or miss using the auto setting.  Otherwise it's a decent camera.  I can't comment on the video capabilities.

Reviews.Title: I *loved* this camera until . .
Reviews.Author: Tiny Spock
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera until the charge/USB port cover broke after the 4th use.  It simply will not stay shut.  It was flimsy to begin with, so I was being very careful with it.  In spite of this, it will not stay closed after 4 uses.  I resist having to hold the door shut with tape for a $100 camera that I had for 3 days, so I'm returning it and am going to try a Panasolic Lumix 4x zoom digital camera instead.  Dang, I REALLY liked this camera, too!  Wish me luck!

Reviews.Title: One of the best Camera I purchased.
Reviews.Author: Dinesh
Reviews.Content: We use this camera so often and enjoy the result very much.  We believe in Samsung product.  Along with our TV DVD player, this camera is enjoyed very well.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Decent small camera for the money
Reviews.Author: TC "Gambtam"
Reviews.Content: This camera is convenience and easy to use.  The picture quality could be better.  Images are not very sharp.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for money.
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: The pictures with this camera can be a hit or miss.  The smart mode is overall pretty decent at taking pictures however to get the best results you usually have to set it to manual mode and program it to the conditions in which the picture will be taken.Pros:-The camera itself is beautifully designed.-Lightweight and small and has a good feel to it.  Very easily carried even in small pockets.-Easy to use.-Image quality is (usually) sharp and color is beautiful.-720P HD-Zooming is quick in both the camera and video mode.Cons:-There is the option of either turning off sound during zoom when recording video or leaving it on.  I hate having it mute when watching so I leave it on but it is incredibly loud.-Though image is sharp, there's a tendency for image to be slightly over exposed.  The flash can way to bright even when changing the ISO settings.-Does not use micro usb which is much easier to use.-Door to battery/memory card access is flimsy.-Must plug camera to charger to charge battery.  I prefer having separate AC Wall charger so that I may charge a backup battery.-Macro mode on this camera can leave more to be desired.Other Notes:-With the camera being so small it's easy to loose a hold of it.  The camera should be secured with wrist straps at all time.-Currently a wall AC charger can be purchased on amazon for $6-15 shipped.Despite having a longer list of cons, I can say overall this camera is nice for the price (purchased price $90).  The major drawbacks to me is the macro mode and the tendency to be over exposed.  I have included several pictures (since none were included) so that potential buyers may make a wiser purchasing decision.

Reviews.Title: Good features for the price
Reviews.Author: roberto
Reviews.Content: very pleased with High Definition  (720p) video recording.  Special features like a super macro make this camera special

Reviews.Title: Great bargain compact camera
Reviews.Author: James R. Smith "Jron"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small easy to fit in your pocket camera and this fits the bill.  The lack of image stability during video does cause a jittery show. Zooming while videoing is better than I expected.  The 12.2 Mp coupled with the optical 4X does a great job.  The battery unit does restrict you from something off the rack in a pinch, so buy an extra battery unit.

Reviews.Title: Very compact, great camera
Reviews.Author: AC
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera when I had it. Unfortunately, it was so nice that someone stole it! I got a good deal on it at the time, so the loss wasn't that great, but I was very disappointed because I enjoyed this camera a lot. It had great pictures for the most part and amazing video quality, especially for a camera so small.My main complaint was ease of use, but that's hardly even a complaint because all you have to do is read the user manual a bit. There are a lot of options to choose from, which is what actually made the ease of use less...easy. But once I got the hang of it, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: Great ultra-thin Point and Shoot!
Reviews.Author: Steve Hamn "Greenspan"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It's so thin and compact you can take it anywhere, and it also takes great pictures!I got this camera as my "Party Camera" it's thin enough I can easily stick it in my jeans pocket comfortably, go to a party and snap some pictures, and if heaven forbid it ends up getting lost I'm only out $100.This is the thinnest camera on the market (0.6") with a collapsing lens. The only other cameras on the market you'll find this thin have a static lens which is a joke.I docked a star on this camera because it uses a proprietary charging port. Just about all the electronics that have died on me over the years have died because of the charger/charging port. How hard is it for manufacturers to stick on a USB-mini which is much more robust and replacements are much more available? If nothing else give me an alternate way to charge the battery. Sorry, if you're not going to do that you lose a star.I ended up accidently putting mine through the wash, so I am buying a second one. Unfortunately, it looks like Samsung is starting to phase out this series and try to push their other (much thicker) models. Get the TL105 while you still can!

Reviews.Title: Samsung TL105 User Review
Reviews.Author: rvbolisay
Reviews.Content: The image quality it gives is very competitive among other brands.  It is packed with very useful features.  With its size and weight, it makes you carry it to most places that you go.  The price is another factor that made me by this item.  And I'm also very happy with its HD video capability.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TL105 camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald A. Birke "Ron B"
Reviews.Content: A great camera for the price. The picture quality of this camera is really amazing for the price that was paid.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Bstngrl
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera!  The screen is a great size and wonderful for reviewing the pictures you have taken.  There are so many features available that I have never seen offered on any of my past cameras, such as a beauty shot, which clears the skin and blemishes of the person being photographed.  The camera is a very good size (pretty compact) and weight (not heavy at all), while still being quite attractive.  I would definitely recommend!  Several friends of mine already have the same camera, now!

Reviews.Title: Very pocketable
Reviews.Author: Rey
Reviews.Content: I actually expected a little more from this camera; it is very slim indeed and I really liked the H.264 HD video compression, however there is no sound when you use the zoom and the digital image stabilization does not work while recording videos either.A picture takes at least 2 seconds or more to be saved in the SD card (way too long), and also if you use the digital image stabilization some other features are not available such as smart filter.I do like the size and the wide angle (27.5 mm) and will be using it as a secondary camera for weekends mountain biking rides.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy!
Reviews.Author: Porter
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews for reasonably priced digital cameras as a Christmas present. I went with this one due to the size, shape, features and reviews. I thought the past Amazon reviews were misleading. The picture quality is VERY poor. Every picture is overexposed - way too much white light. I returned this product.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Camera
Reviews.Author: ds
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good and simple to use. I had a Canon before and I was nervous about switching to Samsung but I do not regret it at all.

Reviews.Title: no 60fps
Reviews.Author: Anton
Reviews.Content: This is not a full review, I just want to let people know that I bought this camera because it was pretty much the cheapest thing I could find that could record 60fps video, but as far as I can tell, that mode just records at 30fps and doubles up each frame. I don't know why it exists.

Reviews.Title: Avoid
Reviews.Author: A. Maust
Reviews.Content: Tried this out for a couple weeks and will be returning it. The picture quality is comparable to a low grade camera phone and the video is mediocre at best. Would recommend avoiding this camera.

Reviews.Title: Is this camera compatible with Vista computers?
Reviews.Author: Beaugarou
Reviews.Content: I have not recieved this camera yet and suddenly realized I had not checked to see if it is compatible with Vista computers.  Can anyone tell me?  I have a HP Compaq Presario.  I went to the Samsung website but no one is there to respond. Thanks for your help.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.2-megapixel effective recording
4X optical zoom
35mm equivalent focal length: 27.5-110mm
2-11/16" LCD screen
Built-in wide-angle lens for shooting landscapes and large group photos
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung TL105 12 Megapixel Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom, 27mm Wide Angle Lens, 2.7 LCD, Digital Image Stabilization, Black
